section_purpose: This section introduces the core methods of the paper, including the background on SAT and Stochastic Local Search, and the theoretical framework for constructing oracle-based SLS solvers with performance guarantees.
key_points: The paper uses Stochastic Local Search (SLS) algorithms to solve SAT problems, where the search process is guided by a learned oracle.
It introduces a theoretical framework that provides performance bounds for the Metropolis algorithm when using a learned oracle, based on the Lov치sz Local Lemma.

A novel loss function, the LLL loss, is defined to train neural networks (oracle factories) to produce effective heuristics that maximize the probability of satisfying the Lov치sz Local Lemma condition.
Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are proposed as the architecture for the oracle factory, which allows the method to be applied to arbitrary SAT problem structures.
